 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּלַמִּית‎</span> usually explained as **adjective, of a people, feminine** ==Shulammite==; — with article as noun <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַשּׁ‎</span> heroine of Song of Songs [[Song.7.1|Song 7:1]] (twice in verse); = Shunammite (from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּנֵם‎</span>, modern ***Sulem***), [[BDB#B|B]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Σουμανεῖτις</span>; but <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎א‎</span> [[BDB#A|A]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Σουλαμιτις</span>; ? compare Nabataean proper name, feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שלימת‎</span> = <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>376</sup>.
